abce.agency.events
Class EventProcedureDescription

java.lang.Object
  abce.agency.events.EventProcedureDescription
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class EventProcedureDescription
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

EventProcedureDescription stores and processes string-based information about the events and triggered procedures. An event is stored in the form: EventType [value] ~ ActionName [arg0=value, arg1=value, ..., argN=value] This class splits the event into the individual components, checks the validity of the components, and maps ActionName into the procedure class it refers to. BadConfiguration exceptions are thrown if there is improper formatting or the target procedure class is not found.

Author:
ruppmatt

getEventType

public java.lang.String getEventType()
Return the string type. In the statement "GENERATION 0:10:end ~ SomeProcedure", this method would return "GENERATION"

Returns:

getEventValue

public java.lang.String getEventValue()
Get the value of the type; may be null if the event type doesn't need a value. This may also contain information about nested events. For example, if the entire EVENT portion of the EVENT~PROCEDURE statement reads: GENERATION 0:10:end STEP 0:10:end ~ SomeProcedure, this method will return "0:10:end STEP 0:10:END". Consequently, EventProcedures that need to base their state off of getEventValue() should parse this string as if it contains additional tokens.

Returns:

getProcedureClass

public java.lang.Class<? extends Procedure> getProcedureClass()
Gets the Proceedure class triggered by this event.

Returns:

getProcedureArguments

public EventProcedureArgs getProcedureArguments()

Returns:
